questions.text: A 45 yr old female presented to the OPD with complaints of palpitation, dry mouth, and constipation. Patient is known case of MDD (Major Depressive Disorder) and under regular anti-depressant therapy. Which of the following receptor blockade due to the anti-depressant drug would have caused the patient's symptoms?
questions.solution: M2 blockade in the heart blocks Ach activity, thereby increases heart rate causing palpitation. M3 blockade in intestines causes dry mouth and constipation.

questions.text: A patient under therapy with alprazolam for his sleep onset insomnia was shifted to Zolpidem. Which of the following adverse eRects should be watched out for if the patient is going to be under long term therapy with this new drug?
questions.solution: Zolpidem is associated with complex sleep disorders like sleep walking and sleep driving and doing certain activities when not completely awake.

questions.text: A 62 yr old, who had few episodes of schizophrenia 10 years ago and was successfully treated with haloperidol, presented with tremors and rigidity. Patient now diagnosed with Parkinson's Disease was about to be put under antiparkinsonian drugs. Which of the following drugs is contra indicated in this patient?
questions.solution: Pramipexole is associated with psychosis, so pramipexole is contra indicated in this patient.

questions.text: A 43 yr old was brought to the emergency who is responsive only to painful stimuli. Blood investigations reveal Sodium - 149 mE/L and Calcium - 13 mg/dL. Which of the following diuretic could be administered for this patient with saline infusion?
questions.solution: Loop diuretics could be used in hypernatremia and hypercalcemia patients because it's a calcium loosing diuretic along with saline infusion.

questions.text: 54 yr old female was bought to the emergency with swelling and pain in the thigh. X ray given below. Which of the following drugs would have caused this adverse effects?
questions.solution: Bisphosphonates are associated with atypical fractures like bilateral diaphyseal and sub trochanteric femur bone fractures.

questions.text: A known case of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease and hypertension was under therapy with Enalapril. On follow up, his HbA1c was elevated (8.5 %). Which of the following drugs should be used with caution in this patient?
questions.solution: Enalapril is associated with metabolic acidosis and as the patient is a known COPD he is more prone for acidosis to be developed. When metformin is administered for this patient this makes the patient progress to Metformin associated lactic acidosis (MALA). Thatsy Metformin should be used cautiously in this patient.

questions.text: A patient came with complaints of severe headache, nausea, and photophobia suggestive of acute migraine. She has a long history of exertional angina. Which of the following drugs is contra indicated in this patient?
questions.solution: Even though Sumatriptan can be given acute migraine, as the patient is having a history of exertional angina and sumatriptan might precipitate coronary artery vasospasm, this drug is contra indicated.

questions.text: A known case of leprosy under MDT presented with fatigue. Blood investigations reveal Hb: 8.2 g/dL. Which of the following would have been the cause of this?
questions.solution: Anti leprotic drugs associated with anemia - Dapsone

questions.text: A patient who presented with upper respiratory tract infection was prescribed an antibiotic. Following which he developed an acute pain in his ankle which showed rupture of Achilles tendon. What would have been the mechanism of this drug used for his infection?
questions.solution: Fluoroquinolones are associated with Achilles tendon rupture. In gram negative bacteria it blocks DNA gyrase. This patient is suRering from upper respiratory tract infection which most probably might be due to a gram positive organism in which case the mechanism is topoisomerase 4 inhibition.

choices.text: Behaves as an anti-coagulant when given with heparin

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding protamine sulfate?
questions.solution: Protamine is a basic drug. More selective for UFH than LMWH. When given as monotherapy it behaves as a coagulant agent, when given along with heparin it behaves as an anticoagulant agent. When administered IV it might release histamine causing HS reactions.

questions.text: A 50 yr old male who was under therapy with heparin came for follow up. Which of the following need not be expected in this patient?
questions.solution: Heparin is associated with transient reversible alopecia and not hirsutism.

questions.text: A patient with dyslipidemia was prescribed niacin. Patient stopped taking the tablet by himself citing that he develops profuse itching and rash whenever he takes the tablet. Which of the following Prostaglandin antagonist is given along with niacin to prevent this adverse effect?
questions.solution: Niacin might cause allergic reactions due to PGD2 and laropiprant is a specific PGD2 antagonist given along with niacin to prevent the adverse effect.

questions.text: A patient under multiple drug therapies landed up in overdose symptoms. For which of the following drugs overdose, dialysis is effective?
questions.solution: Lithium is a drug with least PPB, for which repeated hemodialysis will be effective in overdose.

questions.text: A 74 yr old male, complained of severe vomiting for past 3 days. History reveals he is a known case of parkinson's and is currently on treatment for it. He was given an anti-emetic and his symptoms were resolved. The most probable mechanism of action of that anti-emetic would be.
questions.solution: Anti Parkinsonian drug induced vomiting is due to D2 activation in CTZ. So, a D2 blocker is used for that condition.

questions.text: A patient reported to the OPD with severe adverse response to one of the following drug. The physician immediately orders to administer IV Paracetamol, IV fluids and Dantrolene. Which of the following drugs would have caused this adverse effect?
questions.solution: This is a case of Neuroleptic malignant syndrome caused due to an antipsychotic agent like Chlorpromazine.

questions.text: A patient with COPD and diabetes developed post-operative urinary retention. Which of the following drugs would be best for this patient?
questions.solution: Bethanechol cannot be administered in this patient due to additional COPD. Tamsulosin is the treatment of choice for this patient.

questions.text:
A patient diagnosed with SIADH was prescribed Tolvaptan for few weeks. Following which he presented with dry mouth and increased thirst.

What is the likely cause?
questions.solution: Tolvaptan is an ADH antagonist. Normally ADH increases water reabsorption, if inhibited it might cause increased free water clearance, which might cause dehydration and increased thirst.

questions.text: A patient on hypertension was started in anti-hypertensive medications. Which of the following drugs would have caused this adverse effect?
questions.solution: ACE inhibitors are associated with angioedema (Due to increased bradykinin)

questions.text: A 45 yr old male presented with complaints of diRiculty in breathing. His ABG reports increased arterial blood pH and bicarbonate, arterial pCo2 in increased. History reveals he is taking a drug which increases his urine output for more than a year for some heart condition which he has. Which of the following drug has the least chance to produce this adverse effect in this patient?
questions.solution: Patient is suffering from Metabolic alkalosis which is seen which is seen with Thiazides and loop diuretics. Potassium sparing diuretics will cause metabolic acidosis.

questions.text: An experiment was conducted in dog to find out the changes in BP and heart rate. A graph was obtained as shown below. What is Drug A and B?
questions.solution:
Adrenaline - Biphasic response in BP

Nor adrenaline - Increase in BP with mild decrease in HR.

questions.text: The graph shows below the relationship between Dose (Log) and the response of two drugs (Drug A and B). Which of these drugs has the highest potency?
questions.solution: More left ward deviation, more is the potency.

questions.text: A 45 yr old female on prescription of an anti-HT drug, gradually started to develop joint pain, muscle pain and fever. There was associated photosensitivity and skin changes as shown in figure. On investigation, ANA was positive. Which of the following drug would have caused this?
questions.solution: Patient's ANA is positive, which explains Lupus. Hydralazine induces lupus.

questions.text: Which of the following drugs is used for the treatment of motion sickness?
questions.solution: Anti histaminic drugs with anti-cholinergic properties are treatment of choice for motion sickness like promethazine among the options given above.

questions.text: A 57-year-old man is found to have a blood pressure of 150/100 mm Hg on three successive occasions. He has begun on an antihypertensive agent. After taking the first dose of the medication, he goes out to play golf and collapses on the golf course. Which one of the following drugs may be responsible for his symptoms?
questions.solution: Patient is suRering from Postural hypotension due to prazosin (First dose effect).

questions.text: Which of the following should not be prescribed with theophylline?
questions.solution: Erythromycin inhibits microsomal enzyme thereby increases serum concentration of theophylline.

questions.text: A 68-year-old man comes to the oRice due to thigh and leg pain that worsens with exertion. The patient smokes 2 packs of cigarettes a day Which of the following drugs would best provide symptomatic improvement due to direct dilation of arteries and inhibition of platelet aggregation?
questions.solution: Cilastazol is a PDE - 3 inhibitor used for intermittent claudication.

questions.text: Which of the following is used as a first line management of post-menopausal osteoporosis?
questions.solution: Estrogen and raloxifene, even though it might be effective in post-menopausal osteoporosis, are less effective than bisphosphonates.

choices.text: The drug's serum levels will likely need to be carefully monitored
The drug is likely to cross the blood-brain barrier
The drug is likely to have extensive drug-drug interactions
The drug is unlikely to have any serious adverse effects even when given at high doses

questions.text: A 29-year-old medical student brought to pulmonologist with complaints of shortness of breath and was given a prescription for asthma to which the Physician states that it has a very high therapeutic index. Which of the statements best characterizes the drug with respect to its therapeutic index?
questions.solution: Drugs with high therapeutic index are safer drug

questions.text: A 65 yr. old who came for his general health check up, says that he was on an anti-gout medication for past few months. After the investigations, it says that his total uric acid levels in his 24 hr urine sample has significantly increased compared to before treatment values. What might the probable drug he would have been on?
questions.solution: Probenecid is an uricosuric drug, Which increases uric acid excretion in the urine, so increases urinary uric acid levels and decreases blood uric acid levels.

questions.text: A patient was prescribed anti-psychotic drugs following which he developed Parkinson's symptoms. Which of the following drug could be used for this?
questions.solution: Anti-cholinergic drugs like trihexyphenidyl is the drug of choice for drug induced Parkinson's.

choices.text: Drug B displaces warfarin from plasma proteins; drug C displaces warfarin from tissue-binding sites
Drug B inhibits hepatic metabolism of warfarin; drug C displaces drug B from tissue binding sites
Drug B stimulates hepatic metabolism of warfarin; drug C displaces warfarin from plasma protein
Drug B increases renal clearance of warfarin

questions.text: The above graph shows the plasma concentration of free warfarin as a function of time for a patient who was treated with 2 other agents, drugs B and C, on a daily basis at constant dosage starting at the times shown. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for the observed changes in warfarin concentration?
A patient with gout developed hypertension. The uric acid is found to be elevated. Which of the following drug should not be administered?
questions.solution: Diuretics like HCT and Loop diuretics are contra indicated in patients with gout as it might induce hyperuricemia.

questions.text: Identify the correct match regarding the drug and its adverse effect?
questions.solution: Hydralazine is used for heart failure. Atenolol is not associated with hemolytic anemia, Alpha methyl dopa cases hemolytic anemia. Alliskiren (Renin inhibitor) causes hyperkalemia and not hypokalemia. Verapamil (CCB) causes headache, constipation and pedal edema.

questions.text: An 85 yr old lady, under medication for heart failure, was given gentamicin for her diverticulitis. After few days of taking the antibiotic, she complaints of dizziness and tinnitus. What might be the medication involved in this interaction?
questions.solution: Ethacrynic acid causes more ototoxicity than other diuretics.

questions.text: A diabetic patient presented with rhinitis and facial swelling. An intranasal biopsy revealed the presence of broad based aseptate hyphae with branching at right angle. Evidence of vascular invasion was present. What will be drug of choice for this condition?
questions.solution: Amphoterecin B is the drug of choice for mucormycosis. To avoid renal toxicity, liposomal amphotericin B is preferred.

questions.text: What is the mechanism of resistance by lactamases to beta-lactam antibiotics?
questions.solution: Beta lactam antibiotics are inhibited by beta lactamase which degrades the beta lactam antibiotics (Similar to Aminoglycoside modifying enzymes which cleaves aminoglycosides)

questions.text: Which of the following fluoroquinolone is not given in liver disease?
questions.solution: Pay TM - drug excreted through liver (Pefloxacin, Trovafloxacin, Moxifloxacin)

questions.text: What is the mechanism of action of methotrexate in treatment of osteosarcoma?
questions.solution: Methotrexate inhibits DHFR (Anti-cancer activity). And inhibits AICAR for its anti rheumatoid activity.

questions.text: Which of the following inhibits RNA polymerase?
questions.solution: Rifampicin inhibits DNA dependent RNA polymerase.

questions.text: A 67-year-old man comes to the physician with complaints of severe muscle aches, tenderness in muscles and fatigue for 3-4 days. He has history of hyperlipidemia for which he was taking lovastatin. Last week he was diagnosed with atypical pneumonia and treated with clarithromycin. Serum studies show an elevated creatinine kinase concentration. This patient's current symptoms are most likely caused by inhibition of which of the following hepatic enzymes?
questions.solution: Clarithromycin inhibits CYP3A4 which is responsible for metabolism of lovastatin. As lovastatin accumulates, it might cause myositis and rhabdomyolysis.

questions.text: Which amongst the following statement is most accurate regarding how would the presence of a non-competitive antagonist aRect the potency and efficacy of the receptor's endogenous ligand?
questions.solution: Non-competitive antagonists will decrease potency and efficacy remains unchanged. (like Km and Vmax)

questions.text: A 56 year old diabetic female patient was brought to ophthalmologist with diminished visual acuity. Later she diagnosed of having glaucoma with macular edema. Which of the following drugs would you consider giving last to this patient?
questions.solution: Prostaglandin analogues might cause macular edema which might worsen patient's conditions.

choices.text: To slow down the progression of bone and cartilage destruction
To improve symptoms after one week of therapy
To completely cure the disease, after 2 to 4 months of therapy

questions.text: A 55-year-old woman recently diagnosed with mild rheumatoid arthritis started a therapy with nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), but 2 months later, the physician decided to add a disease-modifying anti-rheumatic drug (DMARD) to the therapeutic regimen. Which of the following is most likely the main advantage of DMARDs over NSAIDs in the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis?
questions.solution: DMARD will slow down disease progression and does not cure the disease. NSAID are only effective symptomatically.

questions.text: A 36-year-old female patient with history of epilepsy was put-on long-term anticonvulsant therapy. On follow up examination there is progressive contractility of visual field. Which amongst the following anti-epileptic drug is likely responsible for this adverse effect?
questions.solution: Vigabatrin is associated with visual field contraction.

questions.text: Which of the following Melatonin agonist approved for use in non-24-hour sleep-wake disorder in totally blind patients with circadian rhythm disorder?
questions.solution: Tasimelteon is FDA approved for insomnia in blind individuals.

questions.text: A 56-year-old male patient with history of ongoing cancer chemotherapy came to medicine department and diagnosed of having thrombo-embolism. Which of the following is the anticoagulant of choice for the management of cancer associated thromboembolism?
questions.solution: LWMH is better for cancer associated thromboembolism than UFH. Whereas UFH is better for cardiac surgeries.

questions.text: Which of the following hormone does not cause hyperglycemia and can be used in diabetes mellitus management?
questions.solution: Amylin increases insulin release. Pramlintide is an amylin analogue.

questions.text: Most appropriate route for adrenaline usage in patients with cardiac arrest is:
questions.solution: Adrenaline is administered IV for cardiac arrest and IM for anaphylactic shock.

questions.text: A 78-year-old diabetic patient named Nilesh being treated with an oral hypoglycemic agent by some quack practitioner develops complaints of generalized weakness, nausea & vomiting with Serum sodium of 125 meq/l. Which one of the following agents should be stopped immediately and replaced by a safer agent?
questions.solution: Nilesh is suRering from hyponatremia (Dilutional) more commonly seen with chlorpropamide.

questions.text: A 65-year-old male diabetic and hypertensive patient taking several drugs presented with septicemia. Serum creatinine levels are 6.7 mg/dL with eGFR 28 ml/min. Which of the following drugs should be stopped promptly?
questions.solution: Metformin is contra indicated in renal failure (If eGFR < 30 mL/min).
